TITLE.P: Framework agreement for food and drink products

SHORT_DESCR.P: Most entities in the municipality have, to a greater or lesser degree, a need to procure food and drink products. The need varies from small units, where the need is limited and the extent procured is small, to large operation kitchens that produce meals for nursing homes in the municipality and who have, therefore, an enormous consumption compared with the other entities. 2 parallel contracts shall be signed based on the above and this competition. These contracts will have an estimated total value of approx. 80 000 000 NOK per annum. One contract will be for institutional households and the other will be for minor households and their consumption. The contract will only include groceries for institutional households (not fresh fruit and vegetables, dairy products and fresh products such as bread, fish and meat), whilst the contract for smaller households will be for a total supplier and will include both groceries, dairy products and fruit and vegetables (fresh meat, fish and bread are not included).

TITLE.P: Framework agreement for food and drink products, institutional households

SHORT_DESCR.P: The competition is divided into 2 subcontracts, one for institutional households and one for smaller households. The contract for institutional households includes food and drink products, but not fresh meat, fish, bread, fruit, vegetables and dairy products.
Note! Note that the CPV codes apply for both sub-contracts in their entirety.

TITLE.P: Framework agreement for food and drink products, smaller households.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The competition is divided into 2 subcontracts, one for institutional households and one for smaller households. The contract for smaller households will be for a total supplier of food and drink products (groceries), but it will not include fresh meat, fish and bakery products.
Note! Note that the CPV codes apply for both sub-contracts in their entirety.

SUITABILITY.P: The tenderer shall be a legally established company.
— Foreign companies: Proof that the company is registered in a trade index or business register as prescribed by the law of the country where the tenderer is established.
The Contracting Authority will require that the selected tenderer delivers a tax certificate for VAT and a tax certificate for tax.
— The tax certificate must not be older than 6 months old at the deadline for submitting a request for participation in the competition or a tender.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The tenderer must have sufficient financial capacity to carry out the assignment/contract. The contracting authority will assess turnover, annual results, as well as key figures in the balance sheet.
— The company's last Annual Financial Statements including notes, the Board's Annual Report and Audit Report, as well as recent information of relevance to the company's fiscal figures.
The Contracting Authority reserves the right to obtain credit ratings on its own initiative.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Tenderers shall have experience from relevant/equivalent deliveries. This means deliveries that can be compared with the extent and content of the deliveries in this contract.

— A short description of the most important deliveries in the last three years, including information on the contract's value, delivery date, number of delivery places, the percentage of any organic/fairtrade certified products and the name of the Contracting Authority.

A quality assurance system is required that ensure that the tenderer is suitable to fulfil the contractual obligations for social requirements (see contract section 6.8). This means that the tenderer has methods for managing the supplier chain and tracking systems that enable follow-up of compliance with:
— Basic human rights, including, amongst other things:
—— No person must be subjected to torture or gruesome, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment (UN’s Universal Declaration of Human Rights art. 5),

—— All workers have the right to fair and good payment that ensures them and their family a dignified existence, and if necessary, complemented by other social protection (UN’s Universal Declaration of Human Rights art. 23.3),
— Everyone has the right to rest and leisure time, including reasonable limiting of work hours and regular holidays with pay. (UN’s Universal Declaration of Human Rights art. 24).

— ILO convention no. 138 and 182 (ban on discrimination), numbers 29 and 105 (ban on discrimination) and numbers 100 and 111 (ban on discrimination) and numbers 87 and 98 (freedom of association and right to collective bargaining).

—— A description of the the system for management of the supplier chain, that the tenderer will use to carry out the contract. This comprises quality assurance measures that enable systematic follow up of the work with safeguarding basic human rights and ILO’s core conventions down the supplier chain/production process.

—— A description of the tracking systems that the tenderer will use to fulfil the contract. The description must state methods and/or systems that enable tracking of the production locations and country of origin involved in the supplier chain for the goods in this contract.

INFO_ADD.P: The request for qualification must be submitted via the tender management system and it must be in Norwegian. Documentation on qualification requirements can, in addition to Norwegian, be submitted in English, Swedish or Danish.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Oslo kommune ved Utviklings- og kompetanseetaten Konserninnkjøp
